subject: Re: [junit] @Test annotation for JUnit 3.8.1
msgSnippet: Hi Kamal, Annotations can be found in JUnit 4.0+, so the short answer is no . Regards, Steve. -- Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales). http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/
messageBody:
Hi Kamal,

Annotations can be found in JUnit 4.0+, so the short answer is "no".

Regards,

Steve.
--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Can I use the @Test notation for JUnit 3.8.1 ? e.g. in :
>
> @Test(expected=IndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
> public void testIndexOutOfBoundsException() {
> ArrayList emptyList = new ArrayList();
> Object o = emptyList.get(0);
> }
>
> If I use it in my test, I get a pop-up asking me to add the annotation @Test
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
>
>
